Sentencas: A coking-resistant catalyst prepared using a novel catalyst support is characterized and its performance on reforming of natural gas for fuel cell system applications is investigated.
Titulo: Reforming of natural gas using coking-resistant catalyst for fuel cell system applications

Sentencas: Two key issues, i.e., the stability of catalyst under the reforming environment and deposition of carbon on the catalyst surfaces leading to deactivation, have to be resolved.
Titulo: Reforming of natural gas using coking-resistant catalyst for fuel cell system applications

Sentencas: The reforming operations are performed using a modified external autothermal reforming (ATR) approach.
Titulo: Reforming of natural gas using coking-resistant catalyst for fuel cell system applications

Sentencas: Desulfurized natural gas is used as a feedstock to avoid catalyst poisoning and air is exploited as an oxidant.
Titulo: Reforming of natural gas using coking-resistant catalyst for fuel cell system applications

Sentencas: It is found that the reforming catalyst is able to remain stable and free from pulverization at the desired operating conditions when alpha-Al2O3 a is employed as a catalyst support in place of the commonly used gamma-Al2O3 counterpart.
Titulo: Reforming of natural gas using coking-resistant catalyst for fuel cell system applications

Sentencas: In addition, the ceria (CeO2)-assisted Pt catalyst coated on the alpha-Al2O3 a support, i.e., Pt/CeO2/alpha-Al2O3, is able to significantly eliminate the coking problem with a CH4 conversion rate >99% and a generated H-2 concentration similar to 62% at 1073 K.
Titulo: Reforming of natural gas using coking-resistant catalyst for fuel cell system applications

Sentencas: A reaction mechanism is proposed to elucidate the coking-resistance of the catalyst, which also accounts for the stability of the catalyst.
Titulo: Reforming of natural gas using coking-resistant catalyst for fuel cell system applications

Sentencas: The reforming catalyst has been tested continuously for 2400 h and is still able to maintain a good operating condition.
Titulo: Reforming of natural gas using coking-resistant catalyst for fuel cell system applications
